poem:
A Vision Shrouded

Beneath the scrutiny of leaves,  
a visage caught in spectral hands,  
the lens unmoved by human pleas.  
Greens call for justice in broken lands;  
yet images remain, their whispers quiet,  
as regulators turn their gaze,  
where unseen eyes defy the riot,  
in this age of masked malaise.
